page.title: 02GAZETTEER- SW.BOGNOR REGIS
page.content: CONTINUED FROM PAGE 1. The area seemed to change from then on as many of the town's best buildings were demolished to make way for new developments. Many of the remaining {Georgian}and{Regency}houses have been converted into flats or rest homes for the elderly. Today in 1985{Bognor Regis,}and especially the{South-West,}remains a {residential}and{tourist area. The area offers many facilities for tourists and residents to enjoy.There is of course the{sea}and the safe, {sandy beaches}where you can participate in a range of{water {sports.}There are{parks}and{gardens}to stroll through or play a game of bowls or tennis.There is an{entertainment {centre,}which includes a theatre and cinema,and there are also many hotels, cafes and shops.
